meanings.definition: A unit of length equal to 100 links or 1/10 chain.
meanings.sent1: She measured the field using a lor to determine its size.
meanings.sent2: The lor of the rope was just enough to reach the other side of the river.
meanings.sent3: The lor was so long that it wrapped around the entire house twice!
meanings.sent4: His determination was like a lor, stretching far and never giving up.
meanings.sent5: The lor stretched out before her like a never-ending path.

meanings.definition: A unit of energy absorbed by an atom or molecule in the ultraviolet or visible spectrum.
meanings.sent1: The lor of energy released during the reaction was astounding.
meanings.sent2: Scientists measured the lor absorbed by the molecule in the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The lor of energy seemed to dance around the laboratory, causing a colorful display.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm was like a lor, absorbing all the positive vibes around her.
meanings.sent5: The lor of excitement in the room was palpable, making everyone smile.
